subject: Re: [junit] How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test
msgSnippet: Hi, ... For what it s worth, on Maven projects I have src/test/resources next to src/test/java and src/main/java . Lasse -- Lasse Koskela * Author of

Subject: Re: [junit] How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test

Hi,

On 9/20/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
> Lasse Koskela wrote:
>  > On 9/19/07, David <achepati67@... <mailto:achepati67%40yahoo.es>>
>  > wrote:
>  >  > I have a method that find a file on classpath and I want to test it,
>  >  > without assuming a particular classpath.
>  >
>  > What I usually do is simply add the file to my "test" source tree,
>  > effectively putting it in the class path.
>
>  I do this, too, and it works beautifully. I typically add a test/data
>  folder to one of my source trees.

For what it's worth, on Maven projects I have "src/test/resources"
next to "src/test/java" and "src/main/java".

Lasse

-- 
Lasse Koskela
* Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
